newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan oil basket falls $1.77 in wk to $19.63.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan oil basket falls $1.77 in wk to $19.63.

text.p: The average export price for Venezuela's basket of oil crudes and products fell by $1.77 cents to $19.63 per barrel on Friday, compared to $21.40 on November 29, the Energy and Mines Ministry said.
The average price for the year so far is $21.33 per barrel, the ministry statement said. Last year, Venezuela's oil export price averaged $18.25 per barrel, one of the highest in several years.
The flood of petro-dollars revenues prompted the government to create a debt rescue fund which would use oil windfalls to pay-off foreign debt.
In 1995, the year's average price reached $14.84 per barrel.
The Venezuelan government has based its recently revised 1997 budget proposal on an average price of $17.00 per barrel.
Oil accounts for some 40 percent of government revenues.
